verses.roman:
athavā bhaktera vākya māni satya kari'
sakala sambhave tāṅte, yāte avatārī

synonyms: athavā—otherwise; bhaktera vākya—anything spoken by a pure devotee; māni—I accept; satya kari'-as truth; sakala—everything; sambhave—possible; tāṅte—in Him; yāte—since; avatārī—the original source of all incarnations.
translation: But I accept it as the truth because it has been said by devotees. Since He is the source of all incarnations, everything is possible in Him.
